poem:
**A New Morning Unfurled**

In Cornwall fields,
badger shadows 
             delve, 
   vaccine's whisper 
   stills the blight.
Twelve farms,
   sunlight tracing 
fur and soil unshaken,
265 small hearts 
   beating, 
   pulsing -  
from sixteen
to zero - 
   eradication,
hope sprouting,
             in the quiet
            dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Vaccinating badgers more effective than culls in stopping bovine TB, study finds A large-scale vaccination programme could help eradicate bovine tuberculosis (bTB) in badgers, according to a first-of-its-kind study with “really promising” results for cattle farmers, whose herds have been devastated by the disease. Over four years, researchers vaccinated 265 badgers across 12 farms in Cornwall. They found the percentage of badgers testing positive for bTB fell from 16% to zero. “It’s the best result". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
